body_content.explanation: the turning of the blades of a helicopter (= an aircraft with spinning blades on top that can take off and land vertically) without using power from the engine, or a single spin of these blades:
examples: As a helicopter flight instructor, she was well practiced in performing autorotations in the event of engine failure.
Autorotation works much in the way of a parachute, with air pressure creating lift on the rotor as the aircraft descends.
